hillbillies.model

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.Scheduler

  • public class Scheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    A class describing the Scheduler, which is attached to a Faction and stores Tasks.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kevin Algoet & Jeroen Depuydt 1ba Informatica
    Invariants:
  • Each Scheduler can have its Faction as Faction.
        canHaveAsFaction(getFaction())
  • Each Scheduler must have proper Tasks attached to it.
        hasProperTasks(getAllTasks())
    • Note:
    Repository link: https://github.com/KivinA/ProjectOGP

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Scheduler(Faction faction, World world)
      Initialize this Scheduler with the given Faction and World.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scheduler

        public Scheduler(Faction faction,
                 World world)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initialize this Scheduler with the given Faction and World.
        Parameters:
        faction - The new Faction for this Scheduler.
        world - The new World for this Scheduler.
        Effects:
      • The Faction of this new Scheduler is set to the given Faction.
            this.setFaction(faction)
      • The World of this new Scheduler is set to the given World.
            this.setWorld(world)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminated this Scheduler.
        Postconditions:
      • The collection of Tasks attached to this Scheduler is cleared.
      • The World to which this Scheduler is attached is ineffective.
      • The Faction to which this Scheduler is attached is ineffective.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • areTasksPartOfThisScheduler

        @Raw
 @Basic
public boolean areTasksPartOfThisScheduler(java.util.Collection<Task> tasks)
        Check whether the given collections of Tasks are all Tasks assigned to this Scheduler.
        Parameters:
        tasks - The collection of Tasks to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if all Tasks of this collection are assigned to this Scheduler.
            result == tasks.containsAll(tasks)

      • hasAsTask

        @Raw
 @Basic
public boolean hasAsTask(Task task)
        Check whether this Scheduler has the given Task as one of its Tasks.
        Parameters:
        task - The given Task to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Task is contained in the Tasks collection of this Scheduler.
            result == tasks.contains(task)

      • hasProperTasks

        public boolean hasProperTasks()
        Check whether this Scheduler has proper Tasks attached to it.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the Scheduler can have each Task of this Scheduler as one of its Tasks and if that Task has this Scheduler as one of its Schedulers.
            for each task in getAllTasks():
             if (!canHaveAsTask(task))
             then result == false
             if (!task.hasAsScheduler(this))
             then result == false
            result == true

      • canHaveAsTask

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsTask(Task task)
        Check whether this Scheduler can have the given Task as one of its Tasks.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this Scheduler isn't terminated and if the given Task isn't terminated.
            result == ( (!isTerminated()) && (!task.isTerminated()) )

      • addTask

        @Raw
public void addTask(Task task)
        Add a given Task to this Scheduler.
        Parameters:
        task - The given Task to add.
        Postcondition:
        This Sheduler has the given Task as one of its Tasks.
            new.hasAsTask(task) == true

      • canRemoveAsTask

        @Raw
public boolean canRemoveAsTask(Task task)
        Check whether this Scheduler can remove the given Task from its Tasks.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Task is effective and part of this Scheduler's Tasks.
            result == (task != null && hasAsTask(task))  TODO  Complete implementation.

      • removeTask

        @Raw
public void removeTask(Task task)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Remove a given Task from this Scheduler.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task to remove.
        Postcondition:
        The given Task is no longer part of this Scheduler's collection of Tasks.
            new.hasAsTask(task) == false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • replaceTask

        @Raw
public void replaceTask(Task original,
                              Task replacement)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Replace a Task in the list of Tasks with a given replacement Task.
        Parameters:
        original - The Task to replace.
        replacement - The replacement Task.
        Effects:
      • The replacement Task will be added to the list, at the index of the original Task.
            this.tasks.set(index, replacement)
      • The original Task is removed from the list of Tasks.
            this.removeTask(task)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • markTask

        @Raw
public void markTask(Task task,
                           Unit unit)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Mark the given Task, by creating a bidirectional association with the given Unit.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task to mark.
        unit - The Unit to execute the given Task.
        Effects:
      • The Task of the given Unit is set to the given Task.
            unit.setTask(task)
      • The Unit of the given Task is set to the given Unit.
            task.setUnit(unit)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • unmarkTask

        @Raw
public void unmarkTask(Task task,
                             Unit unit)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Unmark the given Task, by destroying the bidirectional association with the given Unit.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task to unmark.
        unit - The Unit to unmark.
        Effects:
      • The Task of the given Unit is set to an ineffective state.
            unit.setTask(null)
      • The Unit of the given Task is set to an ineffective state.
            task.setUnit(null)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - A condition was violated or an error was thrown.

      • getFaction

        @Basic
 @Raw
public Faction getFaction()
        Return the Faction to which this Scheduler is attached.

      • canHaveAsFaction

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsFaction(Faction faction)
        Check whether this Scheduler can have the given Faction as its Faction.
        Parameters:
        faction - The given Faction to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given Faction is null or if the given Faction is part of the same World as the Scheduler and if the given Faction doesn't have a Scheduler attached to it.
            if (faction == null)
             then result == null
            else
             result == getWorld().hasAsFaction(faction)

      • setFaction

        @Raw
public void setFaction(Faction faction)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the Faction to which this Scheduler is attached to the given Faction.
        Parameters:
        faction - The new Faction for this Scheduler.
        Postcondition:
        The Faction of this Scheduler is equal to the given Faction
            new.getFaction() == faction
        Effects:
      • The given Faction will assign this Scheduler as its Scheduler, if the given faction is effective.
            if (faction != null)
             then faction.setScheduler(this)
      • The World in which this Scheduler operates will be set to ineffective if the given faction is ineffective.
            if (faction == null)
             then this.setWorld(null)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getWorld

        @Basic
 @Raw
public World getWorld()
        Return the World in which this Scheduler operates.

      • canHaveAsWorld

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsWorld(World world)
        Check whether this Scheduler can have the given World as its World.
        Parameters:
        world - The World to check.
        Returns:
        If this Scheduler is terminated, true if and only if the given World is ineffective. Otherwise, true if and only if the given World is effective, and if this Scheduler's Faction has the same World as the given world.

      • setWorld

        @Raw
public void setWorld(World world)
        Set the World of this Scheduler to the given World.
        Parameters:
        world - The new World for this Scheduler.
        Postcondition:
        The World in which this Scheduler operates is equal to the given World.
            new.getWorld() == world
